714943f-a.title: Manhattan: 101st Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714943f-a.text:
E. 1O1st Street, at, adioining and east of Ehe N.E. corner of Madison Avenue (foreground ) as viewed north eastNard across a vacant lot at the S.E. corner. Buildings to the left extend northward on the east side of the avenue. Note the hospital sign on the corner lamp-post indicating the proximity of Mt. September 14, 1938.

721456f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 101st Street (East)
721456f-a.text:
Madison Avenue (left, not seen) at the S. N. corner of East 101st Street, showing rural conditions. Data on the reverse side of this print is: Amsterdam Avenue and 100th Street, September 21, 1894. A companion view to this was published in the N. Y. Sun of February 11, 1929 as No. 122 in their series titled
"O1d N. Y. in Pictures".
Mr. Hoffman of the N. Y. H. S. corrects this location and bases his conclusions on a view taken from atop the Ruppert house at 5th Avenue and 93rd Street.
1894
H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gtft of Urbrock Collertion

721457f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 101st Street
721457f-a.text:
Madison Avenue (left, not seen), at the S.W. corner of E. 101st Street, showing a sduatter colony ocoupying the block bounded by 101st and 100th Streets, Madison to Fifth Avenues. The photographer is viewing southwestward towards Central Park which borders on the far side of the latter thoroughfare. Note the unpaved condition of 101st Street. A cOmpanion view to this was published in the New York Sun of February 11, 1929 as No. 122 in the series titled "0ld N.Y. in Pictures" and gave as the location, Amsterdam Avenue at 100th Street. Mr. Hoffaan of the New York Historical Society identifies same as the above and bases his statement on the vista seen in a photograph taken atop the Ruppert house at Fifth avenue and 97th Street. This organization has both
views in their files.
H. N. Tiemann Company  1894.
Brown Brothers
